messages.subject: Re: : Re: Boys and Girls
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/28/2003 1:49:49 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... You know, the other thing I m thinking is that this may very well be the first time that
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/28/2003 1:49:49 PM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> YES! YES! YES!! This is *exactly* what I'm thinking! They can talk all
> the
> time but will only see each other once a month. I don't want that to sound
> mean, but for her first *experience* with liking a boy, this is a really
> nice way to go about it. <BG>
>
> And you know, Haleigh is extremely mature, so it helps t have that
> perspective. I agree with you completely.
>
> Thanks Kathryn!
>

You know, the other thing I'm thinking is that this may very well be the
first time that really "liking a girl" has clicked in for this kid, too. Julian
hasn't had any major crushes yet, but in his youth group at church he has at
least a couple of girls in the 12 year old range who have major crushes on him.
Julian is oblivious. I only know this because my partner is one of the Youth
Group Advisors, and it is VERY obvious.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
